definition: to be stupid/to cheat or deceive/me or I (modest)

sentences.english: Any dumb cluck can remain in the darkness and die.
sentences.chinese: 任何無言的愚笨的人可以繼續再黑暗死亡中忍耐。

sentences.english: I have wracked my shabby brain and can find no answer.
sentences.chinese: 我尋遍我愚笨的腦袋卻也無法找到答案。

sentences.english: He gave his foolish nephew some seasonable advice.
sentences.chinese: 他給他那些愚笨的侄子一些及時的勸告。

sentences.english: He was so slow in learning to speak that he was considered a bit dull-witted .
sentences.chinese: 他學講話非常遲緩，以致被認爲有點愚笨。

sentences.english: The foolish boy actor was laughed at wherever he went.
sentences.chinese: 這愚笨的男兒童演員不論走到哪裏都受到譏笑。

sentences.english: The girls are deriding that boy's foolishness.
sentences.chinese: 姑娘們在嘲笑那個男孩的愚笨。

sentences.english: This is where the myth of half-orc stupidity becomes glaringly incorrect.
sentences.chinese: 由此，認定半獸人愚笨的傳言顯然是謬誤。

sentences.english: My great grandfather would have laughed at my fumbling attempts at hitching and riding a horse.
sentences.chinese: 我的曾祖會因我愚笨地嘗試拴馬和騎馬而大笑。

sentences.english: The wise man knows he knows nothing, the fool thinks the knows all.
sentences.chinese: 聰明人自認一無所知，愚笨人自負無所不曉。

sentences.english: She was much better educated than fool of a Beatrice.
sentences.chinese: 他比那愚笨的比特里斯受過好的多的教育。

sentences.english: We gaze at each other as dumb animals gaze at human beings.
sentences.chinese: 我們啞口無言，像愚笨的動物癡望人類一樣面面相覷。

sentences.english: He could be best described as a bit goofy and quite clueless about raising his kids.
sentences.chinese: 在培養孩子方面他可以說是一個相當愚笨與無能的人。

sentences.english: Given his ineptness , many wonder how Ozzel had achieved his rank.
sentences.chinese: 由於他的愚笨，許多人想知道歐佐如何達到他的地位。

sentences.english: Because of mine stupidness, only then misses this section of sentiment.
sentences.chinese: 因爲我個人的愚笨，才錯過這段感情。

sentences.english: The senseless senator's pretense of consensus caused a sensation.
sentences.chinese: 愚笨參議員的輿論藉端引起了轟動。

sentences.english: The skinheads were seen as stupid.
sentences.chinese: 理平頭的男人被看見了如愚笨。
